metadata.title: CVE-2019-17545 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
GDAL through 3.0.1 has a poolDestroy double free in OGRExpatRealloc inogr/ogr_expat.cpp when the 10MB threshold is exceeded.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17545` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gdal-bin - 2.4.2+dfsg-2
gdal-data - 2.4.2+dfsg-2
gdal-plugins - 2.4.2+dfsg-2
libgdal33 - 2.4.2+dfsg-2
python3-gdal - 2.4.2+dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gdal package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.2+dfsg-2').
